name: unassisted
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
without being helped by anyone or anything: She decided on an unassisted birth at home. Base jumpers using special wing suits have shown that unassisted human flight is possible. The work was performed by the Sydney Symphony Orchestra, unassisted by electrical amplification. Ventilators are used to assist with or substitute for breathing when a patient cannot breathe unassisted.

without help(all) by yourselfI don't think I can fix the car alone - can you help?(all) on your ownUK I learnt the song all on my own. single-handedlyShe single-handedly saved the company from bankruptcy.unassistedAfter years of using a cane, intensive physio enabled her to walk unassisted.unaidedAfter six months of treatment I can finally walk unaided.independentlyThe charity helps people to live independently.

More examplesFewer examplesMotor behaviors consisted of repetitive motor actions, sitting unassisted, crawling, pulling up to a stand, standing unassisted, and walking.He finally regained the ability to walk unassisted. He made the world's highest and longest unassisted free flight after he took off from a ridge in Death Valley.
